content:
When working with sessions over ssh, linux commands to manage sessions become useful.
Get a list of active sessions with a w
$ w To skill a specific session, reference the TTY on the session (in my case, its tagged on the what).
$ pkill -HUP -t pts/1
summary: working with ssh how do you kill stale sessions
title: Kill Sessions Within Linux

content:
What behaviours promote credibility with the client.
Being open about what you do not know. The thinking being ai is moving so fast that we can’t know all. This is a risky move; client perceptions are easy to set. Most effective if used once a fair bit of connection has been established. Calling Risks early This gives the impression that the consultant has encountered this before. Gives the impression of being a trusted collaborator, if used well.
summary: Creditibility is an element to build trust. How do we show credibility?
title: Building Credibility for Trust

content:
Trust is build very slowly and lost very quickly.
Yet trust is key to effective consulting; a consultant needs to be trusted if the consultant is to be effective.
Trust with a customer can be built with Credibility, Reliability and Connection.
Consultants should work to improve these levers to become more trusted and thereby more effective.
summary: Trust is the cornerstone of effective consulting. These are the building blocks.
title: Building Blocks of Trust

title: Ai Prompting Template

content:
Ingredients 1kg mutton
100gm garlic paste
50gm crushed garlic cloves
25gm crushed ginger
100gm ginger paste
200gm tomato pur√©e
150gm whipped curd
300gm desi ghee (clarified butter)
2 bay leaves
4 tsp coriander seeds
4 black cardamom seeds
5 green cardamom seeds
2 cinnamon sticks
6 cloves
2 pieces of nutmeg
15 deseeded Mathania chillies
2 1/2 tsp Kashmiri red chilli
1 Onion sliced thin
3/4 tsp turmeric
1 cup water
To taste, salt
Instructions In a blender, mix coriander seeds, cardamom, cinnamon, clove, javitri, red chillies and keep aside. Marinate meat in this spice blend (save 1tsp), curd, ginger and garlic pastes, bay leaves, turmeric and leave aside for an hour. In a heavy-bottom pan, heat ghee and add the onions. Saute until golden. Add water and tomato puree, crushed ginger and garlic, Kashmiri red chilli powder and saut√© until the oil begins to separate. Add meat and stir. Cook until the meat is tender. Heres when you add salt Garnish with the saved spice blend and serve hot. Notes

1kg mutton

100gm ginger paste
200gm tomato pur√©e

2 bay leaves

5 green cardamom seeds

6 cloves
2 pieces of nutmeg
15 deseeded Mathania chillies

3/4 tsp turmeric
1 cup water
To taste, salt
title: Laal Maas

Privacy Policy Analytics and Tracking We use Google Analytics to understand how visitors use our website. Our implementation prioritizes your privacy:
Information We Collect Page visits: Which pages you view and how long you spend Traffic sources: How you found our website Device information: Browser type, screen size (for optimization) General location: Country/region only (IP addresses are anonymized) Privacy Protections ‚úÖ IP Anonymization: Your full IP address is never stored ‚úÖ No Advertising Features: No data sharing with Google’s ad network ‚úÖ Respect Do Not Track: We honor your browser’s DNT preference ‚úÖ Limited Data Retention: Analytics data deleted after 2 months ‚úÖ Secure Cookies: All tracking uses secure, privacy-focused settings ‚úÖ No Cross-Device Tracking: We don’t track you across devices ‚úÖ No Personal Information: We never collect names, emails, or personal data Cookies We Use Cookie Purpose Duration Type _ga Distinguish unique visitors 2 years Analytics _ga_* Store session information 2 years Analytics _gid Distinguish unique visitors (new method) 24 hours Analytics Your Choices Browser Settings: Enable “Do Not Track” to opt out completely Google Opt-out: Use Google’s Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on Third-Party Services We use:
Google Analytics: Google Privacy Policy GitHub Pages: GitHub Privacy Statement
summary:
Privacy Policy

Analytics and Tracking

We use Google Analytics to understand how visitors use our website. Our implementation prioritizes your privacy:

Information We Collect

  • Page visits: Which pages you view and how long you spend
  • Traffic sources: How you found our website
  • Device information: Browser type, screen size (for optimization)
  • General location: Country/region only (IP addresses are anonymized)

Privacy Protections

  • ‚úÖ IP Anonymization: Your full IP address is never stored
  • ‚úÖ No Advertising Features: No data sharing with Google’s ad network
  • ‚úÖ Respect Do Not Track: We honor your browser’s DNT preference
  • ‚úÖ Limited Data Retention: Analytics data deleted after 2 months
  • ‚úÖ Secure Cookies: All tracking uses secure, privacy-focused settings
  • ‚úÖ No Cross-Device Tracking: We don’t track you across devices
  • ‚úÖ No Personal Information: We never collect names, emails, or personal data

Cookies We Use

Cookie Purpose Duration Type
_ga Distinguish unique visitors 2 years Analytics
_ga_* Store session information 2 years Analytics
_gid Distinguish unique visitors (new method) 24 hours Analytics

Your Choices

  • Browser Settings: Enable “Do Not Track” to opt out completely
  • Google Opt-out: Use Google’s Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on

Third-Party Services

We use:
title: Privacy Policy

title: What is happening now?

content:
I am a (mostly) self taught tinkerer in all things software.
I am based out of Auckland, New Zealand.
I enjoy working on Ruby, Go and building simple solutions.
In my day job I consult on Salesforce.com
Attempting to read more, try new things, travel and make every day of my life matter.
title: Prasanth Abraham
